item.title: EHS Shares Tips for Preventing Heat-Related Illnesses
item.description: Managing heat stress is an important task in our day-to-day activities during summer months. Environmental Health & Safety (EHS) has assembled a number of steps you can take to prevent hazardous heat exposure and lower your risk of experiencing a heat-related illness.

item.title: Don’t Miss Troy Pride Night Out!
item.description: Date: Friday, June 21, 2024 5:00 PM - 9:00 PM - Downtown Troy is hosting its second annual Pride Night Out to celebrate Pride Month, diversity, and inclusion! The area will become a hub of music, entertainment, and community spirit, and those who attend can see live performances, drag shows, and circus performances and shop in a night vendor market with local artisans and businesses.
item.author: Community

item.title: Sanzgiri to be in Residence at EMPAC for “Two Refusals” Feature
item.description: From June 13 - 21, filmmaker Suneil Sanzgiri will be in residence in EMPAC’s Studio 1 to film scenes that will become part of his feature-length film, Two Refusals. Sanzgiri will shoot archival images mapped onto fabric—configured at times like dense landscapes—using various rigging configurations and multiple projectors as a means of considering ways of imaging historical memory.

item.title: Rensselaer in the News: New train travel exhibit installed at Rensselaer Rail Station
item.description: A new 16-panel exhibit designed by Joey Morse, an architecture major at Rensselaer, was recently installed at the Joseph L. Bruno Rail Station in Rensselaer, New York to take passengers on a journey through Rensselaer County’s rich rail history from the 1830s to present day.

item.title: OUE Announces ChatGPT/AI Tools Informal Community Space
item.description:
The Office of Undergraduate Education is pleased to announce that an informal community Webex space has been created to focus directly on AI tools being used in the classroom, and is available to share, collaborate, and brainstorm on this topic. Faculty, staff, or graduate TAs who would like to join this space should email Maureen Fodera.
